summary: This document is a subpoena filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team (Jeffrey S. Pagliuca) to compel the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP) to produce documents, communications, and releases related to accusers in her criminal case. It includes the subpoena form and the full protocol of the EVCP as Attachment A, detailing the program's voluntary claims process for victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (Case No. 20CR330) who is requesting the subpoena to obtain documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who requests the subpoena; works at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose estate established the compensation program for victims of his alleged sexual abuse; the program is designed to resolve claims against him.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of assisting Epstein in procuring victims for sexual abuse, as referenced in the EVCP protocol regarding eligibility of individuals who allegedly assisted him.
Pagliuca is the attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case and filed this subpoena on her behalf.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to EVCP
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team issues a subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to produce documents, communications, and releases related to accusers in her criminal case.

events.title: EVCP Protocol Established
events.description: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program protocol is finalized, establishing a voluntary, independent claims process for victims of Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007, Courtroom 318
Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, 1050 Connecticut Ave., NW #65488, Washington, D.C. 20035
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense subpoenaed the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program for all material submitted by accusers, communications, payments, and releases.
The EVCP was a voluntary program established by Jeffrey Epstein's estate to compensate victims of his sexual abuse, administered independently from the estate.
The program allowed individuals who had previously settled with Epstein or whose claims were time-barred to participate and seek compensation.
The protocol notes that individuals who allegedly assisted Epstein in procuring victims could be eligible if they acted under duress due to their own abuse by him.
Accepting compensation required claimants to sign a release waiving future claims against Epstein's estate and related entities, but did not impose confidentiality rules on discussing their abuse.
